p: The general idea of resilience given by participants refers to the ‘capacity’ of a ‘system’ ‘to recover’ from ‘disturbance’ in order ‘to return to an initial state’. It is interesting to observe that participants used verbs, such as ‘to recover’ and ‘to return’, concepts used mainly by disciplines in psychology and psychiatry to refer to individuals or human communities (Aldunce et al. 2014a).
